title: Jennifer Aniston's New Behind-The-Scenes 'Friends' Story Has Fans Feeling Nostalgic
description: Jennifer Aniston called the funny on-set story shooting Friends' iconic trifle scene 'the gift that keeps on giving.'
content:
Jennifer Aniston's New Behind-The-Scenes 'Friends' Story Has Fans Feeling Nostalgic originally appeared on Parade.

Jennifer Aniston, 56, gave Friends fans a special treat on August 11, 2025, when she remembered filming the hit sitcom's iconic Thanksgiving English trifle scene.

"The trifle was ridiculous in the best way," recalled Aniston in a new interview with Vanity Fair. The scene has Aniston's Rachel Green attempting to make a "traditional English trifle" for Thanksgiving, but she runs into trouble when the cookbook's pages stick together. "She ended up putting beef in the middle of a sweet trifle," Aniston recalled.

But the real hilarity came behind the scenes while trying to shoot the episode without laughing. "When we shot the scene and came time for everybody to eat the dessert… They couldn't get through it because they kept making each other laugh," she shared, starry-eyed while recalling the fun memory.

"[Matt] LeBlanc just eats whatever's in front of him, it's not like he fakes it... he really eats it," she said. "Whenever David [Schwimmer] said the line 'It tastes like feet!', that's when they couldn't keep it together. LeBlanc just barrels through, totally into it." The moment gave way to the iconic Joey Tribbiani line 'What's not to like? Custard? Good. Jam? Good. Meat? Gooood!"

🎬 SIGN UP for Parade's Daily newsletter to get the latest pop culture news & celebrity interviews delivered right to your inbox 🎬

"This is one of the greatest times. I love it," said Aniston. "This is the gift that keeps on giving. This is really one of the highlights of my life."

Fans were both touched and tickled by the silly story, and took to the comments to share their thoughts. "It’s really telling how thankful she is for every opportunity she’s given and how nostalgic she is for this moment in time with people that she loved," said one fan, with another adding, "We can see the nostalgia in her eyes." A third wrote, "My favorite Friends episode!"

Fans can stream all 10 seasons of Friends on HBO Max.

Jennifer Aniston's New Behind-The-Scenes 'Friends' Story Has Fans Feeling Nostalgic first appeared on Parade on Aug 12, 2025

This story was originally reported by Parade on Aug 12, 2025, where it first appeared.

keywords.name: the hit sitcoms iconic Thanksgiving English trifle scene

summary: Jennifer Aniston's new Behind-The-Scenes 'Friends' story has fans feeling nostalgic as she recalls filming the show's iconic Thanksgiving English trifle scene. The scene involves Aniston playing Rachel Green, who is trying to make a traditional English truffle for Thanksgiving. However, Aniston and co-star Matt LeBlanc couldn't stop laughing during the scene, which led to the iconic line 'What's not to like? Custard? Good.
shortSummary: Jennifer Aniston's behind-the-scenes story of filming the Thanksgiving trifle episode of Friends has sparked nostalgic reactions from fans and reminiscing about memorable moments.
argos_summary: Jennifer Aniston reminisced about filming the iconic Thanksgiving trifle scene from Friends in a recent Vanity Fair interview, recalling the hilarity that ensued as the cast struggled to keep a straight face while eating the dessert. She highlighted the memorable moment when Matt LeBlanc genuinely ate the trifle, leading to laughter, especially when David Schwimmer delivered the line 'It tastes like feet!'. Fans expressed their nostalgia and appreciation for Aniston's fond memories, emphasizing the lasting impact of the show.
